Package edu.byu.ece.rapidSmith.design

Class Pin

java.lang.Object
edu.byu.ece.rapidSmith.design.Pin
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable
public class Pin extends Object implements Serializable, Cloneable
This class represents the sources and sinks found in net declarations (inpins and outpins)
Author:
Chris Lavin Created on: Jun 22, 2010
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Pin

      public Pin()
      Constructor setting things to null and false.

    • Pin

      public Pin(boolean isOutputPin, String pinName, Instance instance)
      Creates a pin from parameters
      Parameters:
      isOutputPin - Is the new pin an outpin?
      pinName - The name of the pin on the instance (internal name)
      instance - The instance where the pin resides

    • Pin

      public Pin(PinType pinType, String pinName, Instance instance)
      Creates a pin from parameters
      Parameters:
      pinType - Allows specification of an inout pin
      pinName - The name of the pin on the instance (internal name)
      instance - The instance where the pin resides

  • Method Details

    • isOutPin

      public boolean isOutPin()
      Returns:
      True if the pin is an outpin, false otherwise.

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Gets and returns the pin name of the pin.
      Returns:
      The pin name (internal instance pin name)

    • getInstance

      public Instance getInstance()
      Gets and returns the instance where this pin resides.
      Returns:
      The instance where the pin resides.

    • getInstanceName

      public String getInstanceName()
      Gets and returns the name of the instance where this pin resides.
      Returns:
      The name of the instance where this pin resides.

    • getModuleInstanceName

      public String getModuleInstanceName()
      Gets and returns the module instance name corresponding to the instance of this pin.
      Returns:
      The name of the module instance associated with this pin or null if none exist.

    • getTile

      public Tile getTile()
      Gets and returns the tile where this pin resides.
      Returns:
      The tile where this pin resides.

    • setIsOutputPin

      public void setIsOutputPin(boolean dir)
      Sets the direction of the pin.
      Parameters:
      dir - The direction (true=outpin, false=inpin)

    • setPinName

      public void setPinName(String name)
      Sets the name of the pin.
      Parameters:
      name - The new name of this pin.

    • setInstance

      public void setInstance(Instance instance)
      Sets the instance to which this pin belongs.
      Parameters:
      instance - The instance to which this pin belongs.

    • detachInstance

      public void detachInstance()
      Removes any reference to the instance from this pin and removes the pin from the pin map in the instance.

    • setPort

      public void setPort(Port port)
      Sets the port that references this pin.
      Parameters:
      port - the port that references this pin.

    • getPort

      public Port getPort()
      Gets the port that references this pin. Null if there is none
      Returns:
      The port that references this pin.

    • setNet

      public void setNet(Net net)
      Parameters:
      net - the net to set

    • getNet

      public Net getNet()
      Returns:
      the net

    • getPrimitiveSitePinName

      public String getPrimitiveSitePinName()
      Get the concatenated primitiveSiteName.PinName (ex. SLICE_X1Y2.C1) name for the pin. This pin name is unique throughout the device.
      Returns:
      The primitive site name . pin name
